title: How to Check Metrocard Balance: NYC, Adelaide, New Zealand & Tokyo

steps.title: Check your balance at the subway station booth reader.
steps.content: Check your balance at the subway station booth reader. Locate a MetroCard booth reader and swipe your card in the corresponding slot. On the booth reader's screen, you can read information about your card's balance, time window, and expiration date. [1] X Research source If you need help finding a booth reader, ask a subway employee or find a blue Help Point intercom. Press the green button at a Help Point to request information. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Read your balance on a MetroCard machine.
steps.content: Read your balance on a MetroCard machine. Insert your card into the MetroCard machine to access the main menu. Click the “Start” button then → “Choose Language” → "Get Info." [3] X Research source From there, you can access your card type, balance, and expiration date. Once you've found your MetroCard balance, click "OK" to return to the main menu.

steps.title: Read your MetroCard balance on the turnstile.
steps.content: Read your MetroCard balance on the turnstile. Every time you swipe your MetroCard balance on the subway turnstile, it will display the amount you paid and how much money you have left. Remember to check your card's balance as you swipe it if you need to know its current balance. [4] X Research source This method does not work if you have an Unlimited Ride MetroCard. It only works for Pay-Per-Ride cards.

steps.title: Check the farebox if you're using your MetroCard on the bus.
steps.content: Check the farebox if you're using your MetroCard on the bus. When you swipe to pay your bus fare, look at the farebox screen. Your fare will be deducted automatically and your remaining balance will show on the screen. [5] X Research source If you’re using an Unlimited Ride card, the screen will show the remaining time left on your card rather than a dollar balance.

steps.title: Unfortunately, you cannot check your MetroCard balance online.
steps.content: Unfortunately, you cannot check your MetroCard balance online. Currently, the New York City MetroCard does not offer an online method for checking your card balance. If you need to access your balance, you'll need to do so while at the subway station or using the bus. There are, however, several unofficial apps that help you track your MetroCard balance so you can record it on your phone. You can find these apps by searching "MetroCard balance tracker" in your phone's app store. You can also use OMNY, NYC’s contactless fare payment system. Instead of using a MetroCard, use a contactless credit or debit card, smartphone, or wearable device. You can keep track of your balance directly on your device. [6] X Research source Open an OMNY account on their official website .

steps.title: Login to your Adelaide Metrocard account.
steps.content: Login to your Adelaide Metrocard account. Create a Metrocard account here and either purchase a card or connect your existing card to your account. From there, you can check your balance by logging in and reading your account information. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Call the Adelaide Metrocard information line.
steps.content: Call the Adelaide Metrocard information line. You can access your card balance and other account details through the Metrocard info line. Prepare your account and card information to provide to the line representatives so they can find your balance. [8] X Research source The Metrocard info line is: 1 300 311-108

steps.title: Locate a Metrocard information center.
steps.content: Locate a Metrocard information center. If you're at an Adelaide public transport station, you can visit the information center to check your card balance. Give the information center worker your card so they can look up your account and tell you how much money you have on it. [9] X Research source If you need help finding the information center, ask an employee for directions.

steps.title: Check the card validator as you use Adelaide public transportation.
steps.content: Check the card validator as you use Adelaide public transportation. When you swipe or scan your card on the bus, train, or tram, the validator screen will display your card balance. Read the screen while boarding the vehicle and record the number for future reference. [10] X Research source You can also check the card validator while entering or exiting the Adelaide Railway Station.

steps.title: Look up your New Zealand Metrocard balance online.
steps.content: Look up your New Zealand Metrocard balance online. Create a Metrocard account and link it to your card, or log in if you've already made a Metrocard account. From there, you can access your balance in your account settings or on the site homepage. [11] X Research source Log in to or create a Metrocard account here . You can also add funds to your Metrocard after you've logged in.

steps.title: Check your balance at a Metro information counter or on the bus.
steps.content: Check your balance at a Metro information counter or on the bus. If you're using your Metrocard on the bus, you can read your account balance on the farebox screen after you swipe it. Otherwise, locate a Metro information counter so a customer service agent can look up your balance. [12] X Research source Find the nearest Metro information counter here . Have your card ready to give to the customer service agent so they can easily find your account.

steps.title: Call the New Zealand Metrocard information line.
steps.content: Call the New Zealand Metrocard information line. If you cannot currently go to a Metrocard station, you can call their information line to check your balance. Have your card information ready for the line representative so they can easily find your account. [13] X Research source The New Zealand Metrocard phone number is: (03) 366-88-55.

steps.title: Check the Tokyo Metrocard information when you swipe your card.
steps.content: Check the Tokyo Metrocard information when you swipe your card. You can find your balance displayed when you touch your card to the ticket gate or the onboarding machine while riding the bus. When you hear a beep, your card has been read and your fare will appear on screen. [14] X Research source Tokyo uses a public transportation system that is interchangeably called the "Tokyo Metro" and "Tokyo Pasmo."

steps.title: Print your Tokyo Metrocard transaction history.
steps.content: Print your Tokyo Metrocard transaction history. You can access your remaining balance and access history on bus or subway ticket vending machines. Check your balance by inserting your card, selecting "Print Balance History," and taking the transaction receipt. Transaction receipts display the 20 most recent card charges.

steps.title: Add funds to your card at the bus or subway ticket vending machines.
steps.content: Add funds to your card at the bus or subway ticket vending machines. Insert your card and select "Charge" from the menu. Select the amount you want to add to your card and insert that amount in cash into the machine. [15] X Research source You can add between 1,000-10,000 ¥ at a time. If you want to add money to your card on the bus, you can do so by asking your bus driver. They can transfer up to 1,000 ¥ to your card.
